text: Wei Hong. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hong W (2025). WHcircular: Circular statistics. R package version 0.5.0, https://github.com/hongconsulting/WHcircular.
code: @Manual{,   title = {WHcircular: Circular statistics},   author = {Wei Hong},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.5.0},   url = {https://github.com/hongconsulting/WHcircular}, }

title: Circular statistics
text: package re-implements circular-linear regression selected functionality ‘circular’ package improved performance, particularly avoiding construction $\O(n^2)$ diagonal matrices. Additional functions provided time--day variables “HH:MM” format. ‘WH’ code designed maximize speed, use simulation studies. , input validation minimal user responsible ensuring valid use.

title: Circular statistics
text: can install development version WHcircular GitHub :

title: Circular statistics
code: if (requireNamespace("nycflights13", quietly = TRUE)) {   library(WHcircular)   library(nycflights13)   data <- nycflights13::flights   y <- sprintf("%04d", data$sched_dep_time)   y <- paste0(substr(y, 1, 2), ":", substr(y, 3, 4))   print(HHMM.lm(y = y, X = ~as.factor(data$origin),                  name = c("EWR", "JFK", "LGA"))) } #>      [,1]  [,2]                        [,3]      #> [1,] ""    "Time (95%CI)"              "p"       #> [2,] "EWR" "13:25 (13:24 to 13:27)"    ""        #> [3,] "JFK" "01:07 (01:05 to 01:09)"    "< 0.001" #> [4,] "LGA" "−00:15 (−00:17 to −00:13)" "< 0.001"

title: Circular statistics
code: library(WHcircular) y <- c("01:00","01:15","01:30","01:45","02:00",        "23:00","23:15","23:30","23:45","00:00") X <- c(rep(0, 5), rep(1, 5)) theta <- WH_HHMM_to_rad(y) print(WH_rad_to_HHMM(WH_rad_mean(theta))) #> [1] "00:30" print(WH_rad_to_HHMM(WH_rad_sd(theta))) #> [1] "01:04" fit <- WH_reg_circlinear(theta, as.matrix(X)) print(fit$coef) #> [1] 117.1153750   0.3926991  -0.2679492 print(fit$SE) #> [1] 52.26269262  0.03086760  0.02219328 print(WH_rad_to_HHMM((fit$coef[2]))) #> [1] "01:30" print(WH_rad_to_dHHMM(2 * atan(fit$coef[3]))) #> [1] "−02:00" print(WH_CordeiroPaulaBotter(theta, X)) #> [1] 0.002683716

title: Circular statistics
text: Cordeiro, G.M., Paula, G.. Botter, D.., 1994. Improved likelihood ratio tests dispersion models. International Statistical Review, pp. 257–274. Fisher, N.. Lee, .J., 1992. Regression models angular response. Biometrics, pp. 665–677.

title: Periodic B-spline basis for
text: Generates periodic B-spline basis matrix times--day "HH:MM" string format specified interior knots degree, evaluated values x.

title: Periodic B-spline basis for
text: x String vector times "HH:MM" format. knots Numeric vector interior knot locations hours (boundary knots fixed 0 24). Default = 6, 12, 18. degree Degree piecewise polynomial. Default = 3.

title: Periodic B-spline basis for
text: numeric matrix length(x) rows length(knots) columns.

title: Periodic B-spline basis for
text: Wrapper function splines2::bSpline().

title: Circular-linear regression with
text: Fits circular-linear regression\(^{1}\) model time--day outcomes "HH:MM" format.

title: Circular-linear regression with
text: y String vector times--day "HH:MM" format. X.formula model formula specifying predictors. name Optional string vector variable names.

title: Circular-linear regression with
text: string matrix columns: "": Parameter names "Time (95%CI)": Parameter estimates 95% confidence intervals "p": P-values \(\mu\) intercept presented time--day whereas predictor coefficients presented signed time--day differences.

title: Circular-linear regression with
text: Wrapper function WH_HHMM_to_rad(), WH_rad_to_dHHMM(), WH_rad_to_HHMM(), WH_reg_circlinear().

title: Circular-linear regression with
text: Fisher, N.. Lee, .J., 1992. Regression models angular response. Biometrics, pp. 665\(-\)677.

title: Circular mean of times-of-day in
text: Computes circular mean times--day "HH:MM" format, rounded nearest minute.

title: Circular mean of times-of-day in
text: x String vector times--day "HH:MM" format.

title: Circular mean of times-of-day in
text: circular mean time--day "HH:MM" string format.

title: Circular mean of times-of-day in
text: Wrapper function WH_HHMM_to_rad(), WH_rad_mean(), WH_rad_to_HHMM().

title: Circular ANOVA — WH_CordeiroPaulaBotter
text: One-way analysis variance circular data radians using Cordeiro–Paula–Botter¹ likelihood-ratio test.

title: Circular ANOVA — WH_CordeiroPaulaBotter
text: theta Numeric vector radians. group Integer vector group identifiers.

title: Circular ANOVA — WH_CordeiroPaulaBotter
text: P-value test statistic.

title: Circular ANOVA — WH_CordeiroPaulaBotter
text: Cordeiro, G.M., Paula, G.. Botter, D.., 1994. Improved likelihood ratio tests dispersion models. International Statistical Review, pp. 257–274.

title: Convert
text: Converts times--day "HH:MM" string format (example, "14:00" 2:00 PM) radians.

title: Convert
text: input String vector times "HH:MM" format.

title: Convert
text: numeric vector radians.

what: Convert integer times-of-day to radians — WH_int_to_rad
title: Convert integer times-of-day to radians — WH_int_to_rad
text: Converts times--day HHMM integer format (example, 1400 2:00 PM) radians.

title: Convert integer times-of-day to radians — WH_int_to_rad
Convert integer times-of-day to radians — WH_int_to_rad
text: x Integer vector times HHMM format.

title: Convert integer times-of-day to radians — WH_int_to_rad
text: numeric vector radians.

title: Circular concentration — WH_rad_kappa
text: Computes von Mises concentration parameter \(\kappa\) vector radians.

title: Circular concentration — WH_rad_kappa
text: theta Numeric vector radians.

title: Circular concentration — WH_rad_kappa
text: maximum likelihood estimate \(\kappa\).

title: Circular mean — WH_rad_mean
text: Computes circular mean vector radians.

title: Circular mean — WH_rad_mean
text: theta Numeric vector radians.

title: Circular mean — WH_rad_mean
text: circular mean radians.

title: Circular resultant vector — WH_rad_resultant
text: Computes circular resultant vector polar coordinates vector radians. resultant length smaller DBL_EPSILON, mean direction set NaN.

title: Circular resultant vector — WH_rad_resultant
text: theta Numeric vector radians.

title: Circular resultant vector — WH_rad_resultant
text: numeric vector 2 elements: Mean direction radians Resultant length

title: Circular standard deviation — WH_rad_sd
text: Computes circular standard deviation vector radians.

title: Circular standard deviation — WH_rad_sd
text: theta Numeric vector radians.

title: Circular standard deviation — WH_rad_sd
text: circular standard deviation radians.

title: Convert radians to
text: Converts radians times--day "HH:MM" string format, rounded nearest minute.

title: Convert radians to
text: input Numeric vector radians.

title: Convert radians to
text: string vector times--day "HH:MM" format.

title: Convert radians to signed
text: Converts radians time--day differences "HH:MM" string format, rounded nearest minute. Negative values prefixed minus sign.

title: Convert radians to signed
text: input Numeric vector radians.

title: Convert radians to signed
text: string vector signed time--day differences "HH:MM" format.

title: Circular-linear regression — WH_reg_circlinear
text: Fits circular-linear regression¹ model outcomes radians.

title: Circular-linear regression — WH_reg_circlinear
text: y Numeric vector radians. X Numeric matrix predictors. tol Convergence tolerance. Default = 10⁻¹⁰.

title: Circular-linear regression — WH_reg_circlinear
text: WH_regfit list elements: coef: vector estimated coefficients, ordered kappa, mu, betas. SE: vector estimated standard errors, ordered kappa, mu, betas. p: p-values betas. n: sample size. loglik: maximized log-likelihood. vcov: variance–covariance matrix betas.

title: Circular-linear regression — WH_reg_circlinear
text: Fisher, N.. Lee, .J., 1992. Regression models angular response. Biometrics, pp. 665–677.
